meanings.definition: The act of making something less effective or valid.
meanings.sent1: The vitiation of the medicine weakened its healing power.
meanings.sent2: The vitiation of the contract rendered it null and void.
meanings.sent3: The vitiation of the cake recipe resulted in a disastrous dessert.
meanings.sent4: The vitiation of trust in a relationship can be hard to repair.
meanings.sent5: The vitiation of the metal caused it to crumble easily.

meanings.definition: The process of corrupting or impairing something.
meanings.sent1: The vitiation of honesty can lead to a loss of credibility.
meanings.sent2: The vitiation of the data compromised the accuracy of the report.
meanings.sent3: The vitiation of the plan turned it into a chaotic mess.
meanings.sent4: The vitiation of the environment harms the delicate balance of nature.
meanings.sent5: The vitiation of the mind with negative thoughts can be harmful to mental health.

meanings.definition: The state of being spoiled or contaminated.
meanings.sent1: The vitiation of the food made it unsafe to eat.
meanings.sent2: The vitiation of the water supply caused a health crisis.
meanings.sent3: The vitiation of the air quality in the city led to respiratory issues.
meanings.sent4: The vitiation of the reputation of the company damaged its business prospects.
meanings.sent5: The vitiation of the soil fertility resulted in poor crop yields.
